alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 08 at 4:05AM EDT until April 08 at 3:43PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Burlington VT has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New York... East Branch Ausable River At Ausable Forks affecting Clinton and Essex Counties. For the Ausable River...including Ausable Forks...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Branch Ausable River At Ausable Forks. * WHEN...From this morning to late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Minor flooding can occur in Keene. Water begins to overflow onto Hulls Falls Road, Route 73, and Route 9N near Marcy Field. High water will impact interests at Alice Falls near Keeseville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:25 AM EDT Friday the stage was 6.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage to 7.2 feet by 6 AM. It will then fall below flood stage by 11 AM to 4.0 feet. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon.
